locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explains the 'triple passive' in Matthew 27, the concept of the two ages (Old vs. New), and the theological significance of the earthquake and open tombs as God's invasion of history.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong focus on Greek grammar (passive voice) and Pauline eschatology (Two Ages).

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily explaining and interpreting the biblical text, shifting toward promising and declaring in the final two paragraphs.
voorbeelden: The evangelist is telling us here...
Jesus' death has set us free.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from a past-oriented fear of death to a future-oriented hope in Christ's victory.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the sermon's efficacy.

voorbeelden: The course of the world is interrupted here.
The Old Age is what we see all around us.
Matthew is telling us that the powers of death have done their worst.
Think for a moment of your own life.
We orient ourselves not to what we have been.
How fortunate we are today to be here.
God has not abandoned his creation.
God makes you and me and the whole creation new.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological content but often phrased as general truths rather than direct 'I promise you' address.

voorbeelden: His death has set us free.
Today, for all who are in Christ, the direction is reversed.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher speaks with the authority of the Gospel but maintains a descriptive tone until the very end.

indicatoren: Extensive explanation of the 'Two Ages' concept.
Lengthy list of 'Old Age' items (politics, medicine, etc.).
Third-person reporting of what Matthew or Paul says.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer receives excellent information about the Gospel but may remain an observer of the 'event' rather than a participant.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final 120 words.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological density, direct address ('you and me').
voorbeelden: God on this day makes you and me and the whole creation new.

tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used effectively in the conclusion to apply the promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode: 'The Old Age', 'The Evangelist', 'The world'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere for the first 70% of the text.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions and descriptions of the 'Two Ages'.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Today' of the proclamation in the final section.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon avoids moralistic 'Assertive -> Directive' traps.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Two Ages) to Declarative (Set free) to Directive (Praise).
voorbeelden: Jesus' unconditional love... has changed everything. His death has set us free... free for the praise and service.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late but powerful.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: His death has set us free... free for the praise and service.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a masterclass in theological explanation that culminates in a genuine evangelical promise, though it spends a long time 'talking about' the mechanics of the ages.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The concept of the 'Age to Come' invading the 'Old Age'.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid intellectual basis for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The first 4/5ths of the sermon are purely descriptive.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The 'event' is postponed until the very end.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final paragraph, but the preceding sections are primarily informative.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The declaration 'His death has set us free' carries genuine sacramental weight.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the preacher's declaration of the 'Today'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the final address.
tekstueel_bewijs: God on this day makes you and me... new.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon aims to 'unlock prison doors' through the word.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, in the description of the earthquake and the invasion of the future.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Age to Come is invading the Old.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Heavy reliance on 'to be' and 'to mean' in the first half. Needs more 'to promise' and 'to give' earlier.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Age to Come is invading the Old.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God invades your 'Old Age' with His future.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general theological fact to a direct personal encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is concentrated only at the end.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the promise of the 'New Age' throughout the description of the 'Old Age'.
voorbeeldzinnen: Even as you struggle with [X], Christ promises you [Y].

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'The New Testament says' (3rd person).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use more 'You' and 'We' in the exegetical sections.
voorbeeldzinnen: When you see these rocks split, you are seeing God's hand for you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: The balance is actually quite good; the indicative is strong.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply theological sermon that successfully transitions into a performative event, though it risks losing the hearer in the 'constative surplus' of the middle section.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just sending a 'message' about the future, but is the means through which God's future actually arrives (Declarative).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the vividness of the earthquake description, but in the illocutionary act of setting the prisoner free.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the 'Two Ages' theory remains a lecture until the preacher shifts to the Commissive/Declarative 'Today'.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God in Jesus Christ places himself squarely in the path of this world's careening course.
His death has set us free.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The sacramental peak of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly effective for a congregation that values intellectual depth, but requires the final paragraph to achieve its 'event' status.
